page.title: 01Introduction to Pencombe
page.content: As an example of a{green and pleasant land the area around Pencombe must surely be counted.The people here are also pleasant and a good example of this is a story recounted by Mrs M. Davies,The Nash,Pencombe.The{winter of {81/82}was very cold and after four days of{blizzards and drifting}the roads were impassable.In a barn with a large sloping roof at the Nash cattle were overwintering.That evening under the weight of snow the roof suddenly collapsed on top of the cattle causing havoc and trapping several inside.One phonecall to a neighbour describing their plight resulted in a dozen willing helpers arriving within twenty minutes having struggled through drifts to reach them.After cutting through beams with a chainsaw the {cattle}were safely evacuated from the barn with only one injured.
